name: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Product Development

Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Pr: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Product Development The Product Development Process is an integral part of any engineering environment. As such, the skills provided with this Certificate of Undergraduate Study (CUGS) in Product Development can be leveraged to provide additional value to not just the Engineering Entrepreneurship, but all Engineering curriculums, allowing students to be valued member of a hiring organization and not just the engineering departments within that organization. In addition, the proposed CUGS will teach students essential product development skills and contribute their learned expertise to the development of internal and external products.

courses.subject: ME
courses.title: Quality and Reliability in Design and Manufacture *

courses.subject: ENGR
courses.title: Applied Product Development (1 cr per semester. Repeated for credit)

notes: Required Courses: 8 s.h. Students will complete 8 credit hours from the following courses. Only 6 credits from the courses described below (or appropriate substitutions, allowed at the discretion of the CUGS program manager) may count towards other degree programs.

* Note : elective CUGS program manager may allow for suitable 3 substitutions in the event that a course is not offered or another preferred elective with a focus on design and manufacturing is offered. or appropriate substitute approved by the CUGS program manager

courses.subject: ENGR
courses.title: Junior Engineering Clinic (Can be repeated for credit)

courses.subject: ENGR
courses.title: Senior Engineering Clinic - WI (Can be repeated for credit)

notes: Additional Requirements: 4 s.h. Students must complete 4 additional hours from any combination of courses listed below:
Total Required Credits for the Program: 12 s.h.
